description: PLYMOUTH- Despite the threat of coronavirus, Plymouth 400, Inc. is proceeding with plans to commemorate the town's quadricentenial anniversary- just not in the usual way.  "The show must go on, and it will go on," said Michele Pecoraro, executive director of Plymouth 400. "We have been thinking differently about how that will be. Plymouth 400 released a new schedule...
text:
PLYMOUTH \- Despite the threat of coronavirus, Plymouth 400, Inc. is
proceeding with plans to commemorate the town's quadricentenial anniversary -
just not in the usual way.

The nonprofit organization responsible for promoting Plymouth's founding is
revamping many programs for 2020 and beyond to be virtual. In addition, some
events are being rescheduled for when the pandemic is past or have been
cancelled altogether.

"The show must go on, and it will go on," said Michele Pecoraro, executive
director of Plymouth 400\. "We have been thinking differently about how that
will be. From the start, we wanted to virtually spread the word about our
community. It looks like we will be doing that more than we originally
thought."

Plymouth 400 released a new schedule for the rest of the year and into the
next highlighting the revisions. One of the big changes is to Illuminate
Thanksgiving 2020, planned for Nov. 20-25. The annual tradition, which
includes a candle-lighting ceremony and presentation of One Small Candle
awards, will become virtual. Pecoraro said NBC10 in Boston and PACTV will
broadcast the event, though parts of it may be live.

"It all depends on the public health data and guidelines at that time," she
said. "However, some elements of Illuminate Thanksgiving, such as the
Procession of Lights, may be held as a limited and appropriately distanced
event."

In addition, Plymouth 400 is considering making the Indigenous History
Conference a virtual event. Scheduled for Oct. 29-30 at Bridgewater State
University, this symposium could be converted to an online program if the
pandemic doesn't improve.

Rescheduled events include:

Plymouth 400 Remembrance Ceremony - Now planned for April 23, 2021. This
ceremony will be held with visiting dignitaries and local and state officials
to remember the Pilgrims and Wampanoag people of 1620 and their contributions
and sacrifices. The ceremony will take place at various monuments around
Plymouth.

Wampanoag Ancestors Walk - Originally scheduled for August, the event will be
moved to May 2021.

Official Maritime Salute to the 400th Anniversary - This large-scale
waterfront event was planned for this year but has been moved to June 25-27,
2021. An extra day is being added to include a 400th anniversary ceremony to
begin the weekend.

The following events have been cancelled:

Plymouth 400 Commemoration Opening Ceremony - Originally scheduled for April
24. While it is not possible to recreate this event in its entirety, some
elements of the ceremony will be incorporated into other events.

Official State House Salute to the 400th Anniversary - Planned for Sept. 14.
It may be rescheduled for September 2021.

Embarkation Multicultural Festival - Scheduled for Sept. 19. Some elements of
this program may be added to other events.

Other activities will continue with few or no changes because of the pandemic.
Pecoraro said these programs are more informative and instructive through
online or other learning platforms, so they can proceed without concern for
the health and safety of visitors and participants.

"Plymouth 400's planning has always been focused on education, legacy projects
and awareness building," she said. "Many projects continue to take shape as
2020 unfolds, including countless educational programs focused on 17th century
history."

Some of these initiatives include:

Plymouth 400 Online Educational Resources - Offering a variety of activities
for children and families, as well as advanced reading materials for adults,
about 17th century history.

#IlluminateNOW - This social media initiative based on Illuminate Thanksgiving
invites people to "give thanks, give back and let it shine" through a variety
of activities.

"OUR" Story: 400 Years of Wampanoag History - Though the multimedia traveling
museum exhibit is on hold for now, a virtual tour is in development to tell
the 1620 story from the perspective of the indigenous people.

Massachusetts Chronicles - This project includes an illustrated book with a
balanced view of the state's history. A collaboration between Plymouth 400,
Plymouth Public Schools and Bridgewater State University.

Quadricentennial Park \- Pilgrim Hall Museum and Plymouth 400 are partnering
to build this site on Cole's Hill. It will provide an outdoor interpretive
experience of the town's history.

For the latest information about the town's anniversary plans, visit
<https://www.plymouth400inc.org/>.

title:
Plymouth 400 goes virtual

Events rescheduled, moved online
html:
PLYMOUTH - Despite the threat of coronavirus, Plymouth 400, Inc. is proceeding with plans to commemorate the town's quadricentenial anniversary - just not in the usual way.

The nonprofit organization responsible for promoting Plymouth's founding is revamping many programs for 2020 and beyond to be virtual. In addition, some events are being rescheduled for when the pandemic is past or have been cancelled altogether.

"The show must go on, and it will go on," said Michele Pecoraro, executive director of Plymouth 400. "We have been thinking differently about how that will be. From the start, we wanted to virtually spread the word about our community. It looks like we will be doing that more than we originally thought."

Plymouth 400 released a new schedule for the rest of the year and into the next highlighting the revisions. One of the big changes is to Illuminate Thanksgiving 2020, planned for Nov. 20-25. The annual tradition, which includes a candle-lighting ceremony and presentation of One Small Candle awards, will become virtual. Pecoraro said NBC10 in Boston and PACTV will broadcast the event, though parts of it may be live.

"It all depends on the public health data and guidelines at that time," she said. "However, some elements of Illuminate Thanksgiving, such as the Procession of Lights, may be held as a limited and appropriately distanced event."

In addition, Plymouth 400 is considering making the Indigenous History Conference a virtual event. Scheduled for Oct. 29-30 at Bridgewater State University, this symposium could be converted to an online program if the pandemic doesn't improve.

Rescheduled events include:

Plymouth 400 Remembrance Ceremony - Now planned for April 23, 2021. This ceremony will be held with visiting dignitaries and local and state officials to remember the Pilgrims and Wampanoag people of 1620 and their contributions and sacrifices. The ceremony will take place at various monuments around Plymouth.

Wampanoag Ancestors Walk - Originally scheduled for August, the event will be moved to May 2021.

Official Maritime Salute to the 400th Anniversary - This large-scale waterfront event was planned for this year but has been moved to June 25-27, 2021. An extra day is being added to include a 400th anniversary ceremony to begin the weekend.

The following events have been cancelled:

Plymouth 400 Commemoration Opening Ceremony - Originally scheduled for April 24. While it is not possible to recreate this event in its entirety, some elements of the ceremony will be incorporated into other events.

Official State House Salute to the 400th Anniversary - Planned for Sept. 14. It may be rescheduled for September 2021.

Embarkation Multicultural Festival - Scheduled for Sept. 19. Some elements of this program may be added to other events.

Other activities will continue with few or no changes because of the pandemic. Pecoraro said these programs are more informative and instructive through online or other learning platforms, so they can proceed without concern for the health and safety of visitors and participants.

"Plymouth 400's planning has always been focused on education, legacy projects and awareness building," she said. "Many projects continue to take shape as 2020 unfolds, including countless educational programs focused on 17th century history."

Some of these initiatives include:

Plymouth 400 Online Educational Resources - Offering a variety of activities for children and families, as well as advanced reading materials for adults, about 17th century history.

#IlluminateNOW - This social media initiative based on Illuminate Thanksgiving invites people to "give thanks, give back and let it shine" through a variety of activities.

"OUR" Story: 400 Years of Wampanoag History - Though the multimedia traveling museum exhibit is on hold for now, a virtual tour is in development to tell the 1620 story from the perspective of the indigenous people.

Massachusetts Chronicles - This project includes an illustrated book with a balanced view of the state's history. A collaboration between Plymouth 400, Plymouth Public Schools and Bridgewater State University.

Quadricentennial Park - Pilgrim Hall Museum and Plymouth 400 are partnering to build this site on Cole's Hill. It will provide an outdoor interpretive experience of the town's history.

For the latest information about the town's anniversary plans, visit https://www.plymouth400inc.org/.
